subject: testing return;
msgSnippet: Hi, In the following method, How do I test if return is being executed, and control returns to the calling method, which in this case is setAuditContext public
messageBody:
Hi,

In the following method, How do I test if return is being executed, and
control returns to the calling method, which in this case is setAuditContext

public synchronized void setAuditContext(final Stack<LockedValue> context) {
Stack<LockedValue> ctxIn = new Stack<LockedValue>();
ctxIn.addAll(context);

if (ctxIn == null && ctx == null) {
return;
}

if (ctxIn == null && ctx != null) {
ctx = null;
}

I am also using Coverlipse, but the "return" is not being covered by the
following test method:

public void testSetAuditContextSynchronized() {
UUID key = CONTEXT_OP_KEY;
AuditLogger subjectAuditLogger = new
AuditLogger(AUDIT_CATAGORY,
contextParent, key);
ctxIn = null;
try {
subjectAuditLogger.setAuditContext(ctxIn);
System.out
.println("getContext(): " +
subjectAuditLogger.getContext()); //$NON-NLS-1$
fail("failed, since npe is thrown");
subjectAuditLogger.setAuditContext(ctx);
} catch (NullPointerException npe) {
System.out.println(npe.getCause());
System.out.println(npe.getStackTrace());
// npe.printStackTrace();
String s = npe.toString();
System.out.println(s);
assertEquals("java.lang.NullPointerException", s);
subjectAuditLogger.getContext();
}

}


Thanks,
-Kamal.
